title: Queentoshi
author: Queentoshi
content: Explore the plenty options on the forum but be careful adjusting default settings that you do not understand especially as a newbie. I tampered with some setting on my account some time ago, my screen orientation started looking weird and different from the normal. The normal forum orientation is from Top first page (for the OP) and bottom (to see the latest post) for topics that have just one page, and from Top first page (for the OP), forward (or next page), and then bottom of the last page (to see the latest post).My orientation changed to Top first page (for the latest post) and bottom (to see the OP) for topics with one page, and to Top first page (for the latest post)  and forward (next page), and then bottom of the last page (to see the OP). I just could not get comfortable with it, and I have been looking for a way to get it back to looking normal. I would have asked for help, but I wanted to see if I can figure it out by myself, and YES! I FIGURED IT OUT! I know it is not such a big deal for some people, but because I knew how difficult and how long it took me to figure it out, I do not want some other newbies and people who do not know that they are not supposed to mess with some default settings on their account to be in the shoes I was, I just wanted to give an example by sharing my story, my problem, and how I fixed it. Someone will learn from it for sure. To solve this problem QuoteMy orientation changed to Top page (for the latest post) and bottom (to see the OP) for topics with one page, and to Top first page (for the latest post) and forward (next page), and then bottom of the last page (to see the OP). I went back to the "look and layout preferences" and unchecked the "Show most recent posts at the top" option and confirmed it by clicking "change profile".Very simple right? but that took me time to figure out and may take some newbies time to figure out too, just like other settings if they tamper with the default settings on their account.As a newbie, if you mess with the default settings and it makes your forum experience uncomfortable, you may be discouraged from coming back to the forum when you log out, and that will cost you the knowledge you are supposed to get from this forum.
